It was extremely epic
This film is incredible!  It not only contains massive action, but also brings the drama, both done very well.  I was impressed with the Lore, as well.  As we all are all thirsting for more Lore, and not just human drama - a la the Gareth Edwards film and King of the Monsters.  This one brings the Lore quite well, serving as connective tissue.  The A plot is the basic plot, and is easy to follow.  The crown jewel is the B plot, which is Kong finding his home, and you'll have to see it to appreciate it.  And there's a C plot that hits surprisingly heavy, with Rebecca Hall's character.  The action is a bit PG-13, but satisfying for all ages.  But there's even an effective D plot with the Iwi people of Hollow Earth connecting to Ancient Egypt.

Top quality movie, especially if you been a fan of both Godzilla and King Kong franchise over the years!
*If you can suspend your disbelief for this movie's run, you'll see lots of staggering CGI, a bit of convoluted talking about 'the inner' earth and 'the surface', how Godzilla and Kong musn't meet and then some folkloric nonsense about Mothra uniting the portals of both earths. If that sounds like a fairly big stretch of nonsense in itself, that's because it is. The sound in the cinema was completely overwhelming (and I'm not a senior citizen), pointless and farcical (maybe the kids are sensitised to it). There's also a young, hip doctor who insists on blaring awfully trite music out of his sound system (apparently the 70s had the best soundtrack). I like a very wide range of musical styles, but his were the nadir of choices to make. It was a godawful test of the will to endure this movie, but I got a free ticket (thankfully) so my ride was there loving it, so I was bound to my seat. I felt like Alex in A Clockwork Orange when he was forced to watch unbearable atrocities in the aims of making him violently ill. And that's no understatement. When it ended, I felt the joy of a prisoner being released to unrestrained freedom. But if you enjoy prison for a couple of torturous hours, then this is for you. But don't say you haven't been warned ... cause you have*

Well I'm telling you... GODZILLA wasn't scared one bit !!! Good monster movie!!
I watched this last night, along with my wife - who, admittedly, is not a big fan.  I enjoyed the film, but I purposely set my expectations low. There were inconsistencies and coincidences that just took away from the film IMO. But, for what it was - kaijus just going all out, destroying anything and everything in their path - it was an enjoyable and fun experience.  My wife did not enjoy the film. She just felt that it was too confusing and there were too many coincidences that stacked up. In other words, it lacked any semblance of verisimilitude and required too much suspension of disbelief (even for a kaiju film).  One thing I'll say is that the trailer cuts are masterful. It's rare that you see trailers that splice audio and video from different parts of the movie together to create an enticing preview without giving away the whole film.  In summary, if you like massive kaiju battles, this is a good (there are better) film. But, don't go in expecting too much of a consistent storyline.
I predict, this film will be a blockbuster hit, because of its epic large scale spectacle and engaging storytelling. Even the trailer follows the steps of the 3 act structure. I must recommend everyone to watch it in 4D. It will be a wonderful experience.

PLEASE HELP ME GIVE ONE MORE DAY FOR MY CHILD Hello dear users, please listen to my story if you have time. I am an ordinary middle-aged man from a so-called developing country. All my life I have lived by my principles, they seemed to me to be the only true ones. I loved my wife, protected my family, defended my country, did not lie, did not ask for help. I was not rich, but I did not consider myself poor (I was wrong). My family had a roof over their heads, everyone was clothed, clothed, clothed and fed. We were happy. My spouse gave me a daughter and God knows I was even happier. In March 2021, a pandemic took my soulmate and my daughter and I were left alone. But I kept my hands up, worked and raised my daughter, compensated for my mom's absence as best I could. In November 2021, my daughter was diagnosed with SMA (spinal muscular atrophy). We were allocated a place in a public clinic, a local charity offered to help us organize a collection to purchase the drug Zolgensma. And when more than 30% of the necessary amount was collected, I was contacted by the foundation and told that they stopped cooperating with us, calling me a fraud. I could not understand what was going on. The foundation never answered me for what reason they did this to us. Later it turned out that the Ministry of Health reported on the utilization of funds, at the same time, among others, indicating that my daughter received the necessary treatment. I cannot say exactly at what level the funds were stolen. But state databases show that my daughter's needs were fully met. When I started looking for the truth, my daughter was kicked out of the state clinic, and law enforcement came to me and made it clear that there would be more problems. Today the situation is as follows, I found a private rehabilitation center, in which actually my daughter is. It costs $60 a day to keep her in this facility, while I make $7 a shift and $12 if I stay overtime. I sold our house, car and all of our possessions. I sold my left eye through a middleman, now I'm negotiating to sell my kidney, I swear to God if it would cure my angel, I would sell all of myself. I don't know what to do next, I keep working, sleeping on the couch in my daughter's room. I realize we are just one of many who need help, but I would do anything to give my angel another day of life. Below will be attached crypto wallet data, in case you have the opportunity to help us, in any case please help to see this post to other people https://x.com/Adam_Hope3188/status/1772653685224489014?s=20 . Sorry for not disclosing my details, if the authorities of my country find out what I am doing, I am afraid we will not be left alone. With hope, loving father.  0x2d15037E4bAE1303e53d76c417B1c4A5fF77F2E9

By watching this trailer, I realised something: the Kong/Godzilla movies are the new Transformers. They are meant to fill that gap left by those silly, bloated, nonsensical but also highly enjoyable movies by Michael Bay that Paramount just stopped making. At first, the Kong/Godzilla movies were meant to be serious - just look at all the personal drama in 2014's Godzilla, at how gritty and dark Skull Island was. But with time, producers realised that putting drama in movies about giant beings fighting each other is just silly. So put an awesome gauntlet on King Kong and let him at it.

Godzilla VS. the death star well according to mega damage VS. SDC in the Rift universe the death star would win. Godzilla is a Mega damage creature in an SDC world. SDC is structural damage per second, MD is 1000 SDC per second to do 1 mega damage. So, if you don't at least 1000 SDC per second to a mega creature they will just heal so quickly it is negatable damage. To do mega damage in an SDC world would just about destroy your world in so doing. So, the death star is doing enough damage to kill a world it would probably kill Godzilla.1 mega damage =1000 SDC in a second =1 mega damage. 1 mega damage is like a paper cut to a mega damage creature. I just found out about this thanks to the godly ability that is hindsight, but I discovered a cool detail about Godzilla and Shimo!   You all know how Skar King and Shimo are supposed to be the "evil versions" of Kong and Godzilla, right. With multiple parallels to them (like Godzilla having blackish scales and reddish dorsal spines, and Shimo having white scales and blue spines). There's another parallel I just found out!  Godzilla is aquatic and makes his home in the ocean more often that not (water), while we first see Shimo when they're behind a wall of lava (fire) that contrasts with their breath abilities (Fire for Godzilla, Ice for Shimo)

Here's a conceptual outline for a series of Godzilla and Kong movies that subtly hint at SpaceGodzilla's existence, leading up to a climactic reveal in the final film:  **Film 1: Godzilla: Echoes of the Void** - **Plot:** Godzilla battles a new Titan that has emerged from the depths of the ocean. Monarch discovers alien DNA within the Titan, suggesting extraterrestrial origins. - **Hint:** Post-credits scene shows a meteorite heading towards Earth, with a faint, sinister roar echoing from within.  **Film 2: Kong: Hollow Earth Sovereign** - **Plot:** Kong defends his dominion in the Hollow Earth against invading creatures. He discovers ancient murals depicting a battle between Godzilla's ancestors and a mysterious cosmic entity. - **Hint:** A Monarch team studying cosmic radiation picks up unusual signals resembling the alien DNA found earlier.  **Film 3: Godzilla: Rise of the Leviathans** - **Plot:** Godzilla faces multiple Titans rising simultaneously around the world. Monarch theorizes they are being awakened by a powerful external force. - **Hint:** A crystalline structure is found on one of the defeated Titans, unlike anything on Earth.  **Film 4: Kong: Apex Predator** - **Plot:** Kong encounters a new threat in the Hollow Earth, a creature that seems to be a corrupted version of Godzilla's species. - **Hint:** Monarch uncovers a link between the creature and the meteorite, which is now closer to Earth.  **Film 5: Godzilla X Kong: Battle for the Cosmos** - **Plot:** The final showdown. As the meteorite crashes, SpaceGodzilla emerges, threatening all life on Earth. - **Hint:** Throughout the movie, flashbacks and Monarch's research connect the dots, revealing SpaceGodzilla's backstory and its ties to Godzilla and Kong's lineage.  This approach allows for a gradual buildup of mystery and anticipation, with each movie contributing pieces to the puzzle of SpaceGodzilla's existence, culminating in an epic confrontation that ties together the entire saga.

Anyone else feel like ownership of the Godzilla concept including the right to make Godzilla movies need to go back entirely to the Japanese?  Just me? Ok. Shin Godzilla and Godzilla Minus One were much better movies without the token diversity roles, the obligatory British genius/nerd/swashbuckler, and the world-ending stakes. Japanese Godzilla movies tended to be more about the humans and how they interacted in the presence of a kaiju. Godzilla itself was ambiguous and was variously explained as a product of nuclear testing or a representation of Japan's collective guilt for their crimes during World War II.   Hollywood Godzilla? Well that trailer was a hoot, a lot of nonstop Showa-esque action and insanity. Since there are so much new scenes and tidbits to be pointed out, I'll try to do the job myself so anyone would have a picture of what would happen in the film. So, beware of possible spoilers.     0:01 - 0:11 We see Kong, welding the B.E.A.S.T glove, appearing from a recently made Hallow Earth tunnel, most likely in search of Godzilla after narrowly avoiding death at the hands of Shimo and Skar King. The B.E.A.S.T may very well be a homage to Show Kong since he absorbed lighting and was able to discharge electricity through touch during his last fight with Showa Godzilla. 0:11 - 0:13 Godzilla swimming, in his pre evolved appearance, probably at Rome, Italy. 0:13 - 0:18 Godzilla, in his evolved appearance, mostly likely Egypt, most likely having sensed and hunting Kong 0:30 We see flashes of Mothra, Pre evolved Godzilla, apparently Godzilla directing Shimo's ice beam at Skar King and Suko's direction in Rio and Shimo's ice beam. 0:47 -  1:00 Kong at Rio? Godzilla leaving Rome, probably heading north to evolve. Perhaps Godzilla was on the search for Shimo since we see a tower of ice slicing through the ground and killing a civilian in the previous trailer. 1:34 Looks like Skar King has his own council or group of commanders by his side, like Megatron had with Starscream, Soundwave and Shockwave.  1:55 - 2:00 Looks to me that Kong's axe may very well be destroyed since we see him with the B.E.A.S.T glove and no axe after. 2:11 - 2:14 Shimo implementing a new ice age as part of Skar King's plan for global terraforming. 2:18 - 2:22 Even though they left in peace, it was still very much a truce. Godzilla and Kong still not seeing eye to eye. Likely that Kong will try to communicate with Godzilla to form an alliance to face their shared adversaries, since it's implied that Godzilla was hunting for Shimo. 2:27 - 2:29 Kong punching Skar King like the dickens, the tooth no doubt being a point which I'll explain later. 2:30 - 2:34 Pre evovled Godzilla at a industral site? Nuclear power plant? Taking down unmanned drones with a nuclear pulse. Pretty much what Godzilla's Burning form would've been without the Mothra powerup. As to why he's still causing destruction, terrorists? Anti - Titan activity? 2:38 - 2:40 Suko sticking it to one of Skar King's councilmean/commanders 2:50 We see Kong apparently having a silver tooth, implying that maybe he lost it during his fight fight with Skar King, hence the previous bit showing Kong returning the favor. An eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth. 2:52 The obligatory Avengers assemble shot, nice to see Evovled Godzilla not being skinny as the toys have him with apparently no gut. We've seen skinny versions of Godzilla throughout a number of films. The 60 - 70's Showa films, Godzilla 2000: Millennium, Godzilla Against MechaGodzilla - Godzilla: Tokyo SOS and Godzilla Final Wars.

Using the USâ€™s 400 Kiloton, B61 Thermal Nuclear bomb, it can be deployed anywhere because it can be stored on Aircraft carriers and can be deployed on a F/A-18 Hornet or F-16 Fighting Falcon.  2. Depleted Uranium Rounds and Munitions  Depleted uranium rounds are typically used for piercing through enemy armor. For example its used in tank munitions to be able to pierce right through its heavy armor like paper. So by using high caliber, depleted uranium rounds we can administer a venom or poison inside the bullet to act like a needle. This will subdue him/kill him.  3. Salicylic Acid Also known as C7H6O3, Salicylic acid is used to dissolve keratin, and reptilian scales are typically made of keratin, so by dumping a ton of Salicylic acid on him it will weaken his scales and then we can use conventional weaponry on him.

Look, I don't care what anyone says.  This looks so amazingly fun and exciting.  I love that we have so many different types of Godzilla movies. One's that are Dark and serious with substance  As well as one's that are Fun and exciting for escapism.  Godzilla has always been a versatile character and people that think Godzilla should only be grounded and serious clearly don't understand the appeal of the franchise.  Godzilla Minus one was amazing, but it absolutely does NOT have to be the standard for the ENTIRE franchise. There is a Godzilla for everyone.  If this movie doesn't appeal to you, then clearly the Monsterverse just isn't for you. And that's okay. There are other Godzilla movies that suits your preference just like everyone else.  We G-fans don't really have any reason to be so upset and pessimistic. Again, there is a Godzilla for EVERYONE.

I have a theory about Godzillas new design and how he changed. In the KoTM novelization, it was stated that Godzilla was able to adapt and evolve in able to survive. That being said, I think Godzilla knew he couldn't face all those Kongs at once, he simply wasn't agile or powerful enough. Goji proceeds to seal himself away in ice and he begins to "evolve", having longer and stronger arms, a thinner, more agile build capable for running and quicker movement speed, to top it all off a red spiral breath more powerful than his standard atomic breath we're all used too. This is just a theory of mine, and I'd personally would love to hear other peoples opinions and theories as well!!

I've just finished watching Godzilla vs. Kong: The New Empire, and I couldn't help but notice a significant shift in the CGI and VFX effects. ğŸ¥ It feels like this change began with the first Godzilla vs. Kong movie, where both Godzilla and Kong didn't quite evoke the same sense of awe and terror as they did in Godzilla (2014), Godzilla: King of the Monsters, and Skull Island. ğŸ¦–ğŸ¦ In those earlier films, they were portrayed as gigantic, formidable beasts, forces of nature to be feared and respected. ğŸŒ‹ğŸŒª However, in the Godzilla vs. Kong movies, they seem to display more human-like behaviors, losing some of that primal, monstrous essence. ğŸ¤”  I understand that Kong, being an ape, has more relatable characteristics to humans, but the Kong I encountered in Skull Island was a creature that sent shivers down my spine. There was an aura of primal ferocity and mystery surrounding him that seems to have been somewhat diluted in the newer films. ğŸŒŸ What we need is for Godzilla and Kong to return to being the terrifying, awe-inspiring monsters that once roamed the Earth, instilling fear and wonder in equal measure. ğŸ‘¹ğŸŒ   But amazing trailer over all just one small thing i noticed that i think need some attention.ğŸ¤—

I liked Godzilla 2014 very much. Although Godzilla King of the Monsters was a sillier movie, I thought it was great fun and I loved seeing Mosura, Ghidrah, and Rodan in their Legendary incarnations -- GREAT stuff, even if the human characters and storyline again disappointed. Next, Godzilla vs. Kong was extremely silly, dumb fun, with obnoxious human characters and bad writing, but it featured some truly EPIC showdowns between Godzy and Kong. This one... I'm trying to get excited about it, but the CGI/design looks terrible, and the writing seems aimed squarely at the seven-year-old mindset. I'm expecting it to bomb amid terrible reviews, but this lifelong Godzilla fan hopes to be proven wrong.

Godzilla - Miyagi Do Kong - Eagle Fang Skar King & Shimo - Cobra Kai
This might be the best movie of all time
How many movies with apes do we need in 2019-2024? new Transformers, Planet of the Apes, Kong vs Godzilla three times. Considering there are about five to ten huge cinematic releases each year, about 15% of our biggest movies have monkeys as main protagonists in them. Time to make giant ape a mascot of mankind? It seems like it truly does sell. Also about 50% of the biggest blockbusters portray a giant war as the main driver of the story. It's like a big part of our history is finding an excuse for a war and then fighting for years and the movies reflect that. The plot of almost entire MCU is some folks with superpowers spend a little time finding a reason to fight and then they fight for two hours straight. Endgame was basically just that with no variation to an already working scheme. If any MCU movie has at least an attempt to tell a story it bombs at the box office. It's like a food for amygdala rather than an actual movie, you can compare it to a rollercoaster ride, the more adrenaline it pumps in your veins, the better the movie, both critics and audience agree. Is this the current state of cinema? Endless wars and giant monkeys, really?

A battle for the supremacy of Earth, two titans seem as gods in ancient times, whose peoples have been in a war more older than humankind himself. They fought against each other, but they unite to destroy a monster made of metal created by humans to end their domain. Together, they ended both the monster and their eternal rivalry, having peace between titans and humans. But this peace gets interrupted by an ape titan name Scar king, who self proclaims to by the all mighty emperor of the Hollow Earth, who destroys and conquers anything on his path, marking them with his bloody hands. Now the champion of humanity Kong and the king of monsters Godzilla have to fight together once again and end the tyranny of Scar King once and for all.
